reviewText: MAD Magazine's creator, William M. Gaines also published in the early-1950s the legendary comic books TALES FROM THE CRYPT,THE HAUNT OF FEAR and THE VAULT OF HORROR. This 1973 film is inspired by the latter. Here, five men ride an elevator that unexpectedly goes beyond the lobby to a sub-basement. The doors open to a comfy lounge where they sit and take turns relating a disturbling dream. The movie is thus divided into five segments: "Midnight Mass" - Rogers (Massey) visits a town that shuts up tight at sunset because that's when "they" come out! "The Neat Job" - Crirchit (Terry-Thomas) drives his wife (Johns) berserk with his neat-freak ways. "This Trick'll Kill You" - Magician (Jürgens) will do *anything* to obtain an Indian girl's rope trick. "Bargain in Death" - A man (Craig) scams insurers by having himself buried alive while in suspended animation. "Drawn and Quartered" - Artist (Moore) visits a Haitian mystic and is given voodoo powers via his paintbrush. Each of these stories ends in a macabre surprise. After all dreams are told, the elevator opens, the five ascend and we are treated to the final plot twist. Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 imdb user poll rating. (6.3) The Vault of Horror (UK/USA-1973) - Terry-Thomas/Glynis Johns/Curd Jürgens/Tom Baker/Michael Craig/Daniel Massey/Anna Massey/Dawn Addams/Denholm Elliott
